TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Window/MdiSysButton extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the **System** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window with visual styles. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Window.MdiSysButton class gets a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the **System** button of an MDI child window. This button opens the **Window** menu (also known as the **System** menu or **Control** menu) when it is clicked.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Window.MdiSysButton.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowMdiSysButton1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#367](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_83_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#367](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_83_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the **System** button of a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents the **System** button of an MDI child window in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowMdiSysButton4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#370](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f66ab3b3-2d96-4eb5-97ab-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#370](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f66ab3b3-2d96-4eb5-97ab-_1.vb)]
